'''Mamoswine''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''マンムー''' ''Mammoo'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ice|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Piloswine}} when [[level]]ed up while knowing {{m|Ancient Power}}. It is the final form of {{p|Swinub}}.

==Biology==
Mamoswine resembles a wooly mammoth crossed with a boar. Its brown fur is very thick to endure harsh cold and protect from snow and ice. Its tusks, which are smaller on a female Mamoswine than on a male, are made of pure, solid ice. Mamoswine has a blue mask-like pattern with a white rim around its face, resembling ski goggles. The fur on its muzzle is tan and shaggy, and its nose resembles that of a pig. Mamoswine's feet are black with three thick toes, and its tail is small. It can endure harsh cold and hunger for an almost indefinite amount of time, as indicated by a ten-thousand-year-old specimen reviving. Mamoswine lived all around the world during the last {{wp|ice age}}, but its population thinned when the climate grew warmer.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Serena Mamoswine.png|thumb|left|250px|Mamoswine in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Dawn's Mamoswine]]====
{{an|Dawn}} has a Mamoswine, which evolved from a {{p|Piloswine}} in ''[[DP106|A Breed Stampede!]]''. There was a time where Mamoswine [[Obedience|would not listen]] to Dawn's commands, but it eventually realized how deeply she cared for it in ''[[DP119|Trials and Adulations!]]'' and started obeying her. Since then, Mamoswine became a reliable partner and was used in many [[Contest Battle]]s.

====Other====
Mamoswine debuted in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]'', where a herd helped {{p|Regigigas}} stop a sliding glacier that endangered a nearby [[Gracidea (Sinnoh)|Gracidea garden]] and several towns and villages.

A Mamoswine appeared in ''[[BW140|Survival of the Striaton Gym!]]'', under the ownership of [[Morana]]. Mamoswine appeared during a flashback, where it was seen battling and defeating [[Chili's Pansear]].

Multiple Mamoswine appeared in ''[[XY083|Over the Mountain of Snow!]]'', including two of them that were hired by {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} to take a shortcut on {{rt|17|Kalos}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Mamoswine appeared in a fantasy in ''[[XY101|A Dancing Debut!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Diamond Moo.png|thumb|200px|Mamoswine in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Prior to ''[[PS411|Double Trouble with Dialga and Palkia I]]'' {{adv|Platinum}} caught a Mamoswine. She gave him to {{adv|Diamond}} without using him, as he reminded her of the boy. He nicknamed him "Moo."

In ''[[PAXY29|Hawlucha Attack]]'', {{adv|X}} and his friends road on five Mamoswine while going through [[Kalos Route 17]] to reach [[Anistar City]], to meet [[Professor Sycamore]] at the Sundial.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
[[Koya]] has a Mamoswine was used in the battle against [[Hareta]] in ''[[DPA26|Hearts and Spirits Collide]]''. It took down {{TP|Hareta|Regigigas}} with a single {{m|Take Down}}, then used {{m|Hail}} in combination with its {{a|Snow Cloak}} to dodge {{TP|Hareta|Empoleon}}'s {{m|Hydro Pump}}. However, Hareta was able to feel the vibrations created by Mamoswine's charge, allowing him to locate and defeat it.

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
A Mamoswine appeared in [[PMDP16]].

==Trivia==
* Mamoswine's {{game3|Diamond and Pearl|Pokémon Diamond, Pearl|s}}, {{game3|HeartGold and SoulSilver|SoulSilver|s}} and {{pkmn|X and Y|Y}} Pokédex entries are a reference to how {{wp|woolly mammoth}}s became extinct.
* Mamoswine would have been obtainable in both [[Generation II]] and [[Generation III]] if it had existed, as {{p|Piloswine}} could learn {{m|Ancient Power}} in both generations. It shares this trait with {{p|Lickilicky}}.
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Mamoswine and its pre-evolutions, {{p|Swinub}} and {{p|Piloswine}}.
** Mamoswine and its pre-evolutions are also the only Pokémon weak to the types of all three [[starter Pokémon]].

===Origin===
Mamoswine appears to be based on a combination of a {{wp|woolly mammoth}} and a {{wp|wild boar}}. The blue around its eyes also resembles ski goggles.

====Name origin====
Mamoswine is a combination of ''mammoth'' and ''swine''.

Mammoo may be a combination of ''mammoth'' and ぶうぶう ''būbū'' ({{wp|onomatopoeia}} for oinking).
